Tier Benefits:
Benefits of Affiliates Membership

Members in the Aeronautics and Astronautics Industrial Affiliates Program receive the following benefits:

    Participation in annual technical meeting
    An annual, one-day meeting where state-of-the-art research is presented by students and faculty in the department, with opportunities for interaction and lab visits.
    Direct contact with faculty
    A faculty member with appropriate technical interests serves as the affiliate's point of contact within the department. Affiliate companies may contact faculty members for further consultation, discussions and to arrange visits to the affiliate's site. The purpose of these visits is to make technical presentations of the Program’s research results. The site presentations and all information, data and results arising from such visitation interactions will be shared with all members and the public.
    Dissemination of technical information
    Members have online access to all research and poster presentations that take place during the annual meeting.
    Exchange of visitors
    Opportunities for members to send Visiting Scholars under the University's policies to work in the department's research facilities.
    Interaction with industry representatives from other member companies
    Opportunities to meet with senior representatives of other affiliate companies.
    Contact with graduate students
    Affiliates can meet with graduate research students during campus visits and discuss potential job opportunities for them for summer internships or full-time employment.
    The Aeronautics and Astronautics Industrial Affiliates Program Researchers will use and develop open-source software, and it is the intention of all Aeronautics and Astronautics Industrial Affiliates Program Program researchers that any software released will be released under an open source model, such as BSD. The Program is open to all Stanford faculty who share this goal.

Tier Benefits:
ECE Access Tier 3: White
With Tier 3, your access to ECE comes with all of our standard services, as well as one additional service from column A.

ECE Access Tier 2: Silver
With Tier 2, your access to ECE comes with all of our standard services, two additional services from column A, and early access to resumes.

ECE Access Tier 1: Gold
With Tier 1, your access to ECE comes with all of our standard services, two additional services from column A, one additional service from column B, early access to resumes, and concierge service.

STANDARD SERVICES

Assistance with organizing virtual meetings with ECE student organizations (Fall or Spring semester)

Corporate Partners: List of Companies not listed publically
Tiers of Membership: Affiliate programs (Corporate Connection; Power Affiliates) – tiers not published
Tier Benefits:
Depending on the Tier selected, you may receive priority access to several different recruiting events, including an exclusive invitation to the Corporate Connection After Hours Event, a Corporate Day and unlimited Tech Talks in the home buildings of the Siebel School and ECE Department. Members of the program have first chance to book space for campus events, and work with an account manager to help you make the most of your time on campus.

Becoming a Corporate Connection partner will increase your visibility to students, provide you assistance in organizing campus visits, and allow you to target specific students as you recruit. You'll also be given first consideration in involvement with and sponsorship for student events, workshops, scholarships, and other projects. Plus, the annual partnership contribution supports program activities, educational and outreach activities, student projects, student organizations, scholarships, and other investments to strengthen the infrastructure of the Siebel School and ECE Department.

Tier Benefits:
Capstone Partner

Companies are introduced to ECE undergrad students in the senior design course to facilitate company interaction and student recruiting. Structured engagement throughout the course between companies and students includes information sessions, opportunities for direct team interactions, and final demos. This financial support is used to enhance project resources for these students.
Capstone Partner Benefits:

    Invitation for Capstone Intro, Engagement and Demo Day
    Support for Fall Recruiting Day in ECE
    Option for sponsor-directed projects ($15k/semester/project)

Curriculum Partner

Companies participate in an annual cycle of recruiting and curricular events. Features include Course Engagement, Fall Recruiting, and a Spring Curriculum Caucus. Additionally, Curriculum Partners are supported in recruiting through on-campus events and the administration of recruitment-focused student scholarships and fellowships.
Curriculum Partner Benefits:

    Invitation to Curricular Engagement with ECE faculty
    Intro to select courses and faculty for potential guest lectures and project judging
    All Foundational partner benefits

ACCESS TO STUDENTS

CAP provides a variety of services to help your company build its brand at the Jacobs School of Engineering and successfully search for qualified employees.

    We help you define and execute your Talent Acquisition Strategy on campus

RESEARCH

Research collaborations with the Jacobs School yield results for your company. From brainstorming meetings that encourage engineers to research contracts with defined deliverables, Jacobs School faculty are eager to work with your company. CAP helps identify and facilitate collaborations.

There is no cost to the corporate partner to set up a partnership. It is simply a commitment to promote and encourage employees to further their education and to reach their educational goals. The Systems Engineering program will provide degree information and materials that you may share with your interested employees.
    No minimum number of employees need to enroll.
    Becoming a partner does not limit the employees to enroll with Systems Engineering only. It simply means that if any employee chooses to enroll in our program, they will receive the benefits included in the partnership agreement.

Gold


    Includes Silver Level benefits along with:
    Customized assistance in contacting graduate students in the areas of interest to the member company; assistance to set up on-site interviews

The visitor is provided with office space and is given full access to our computer facilities, libraries, and research laboratories, and the visitor is entitled to attend all classes and lectures and to freely interact with our faculty and students
    One representative on the department’s advisory board to provide valuable input and feedback to the department regarding its education and research directions
    Participation in the undergraduate senior-year project program in which the member company can propose a year-long project for a team of 3-4 students to work on as their senior-year project under the supervision of a faculty advisor

Tier Benefits:
Student recruiting, sponsored research, lab access, events. Working in partnership with our pioneering faculty and our driven and creative students, you have the means to address some of society’s most complex and critical problems. We can help you find and develop talent, expand your reach, and build your brand story. Together we will create solutions and prepare visionary leaders ready to implement them. Hopkins Engineering works closely with researchers and clinicians at JHU’s School of Medicine, Bloomberg School of Public Health, and the Applied Physics Laboratory—the largest university-affiliated research center in the United States.

Johns Hopkins Technology Ventures (JHTV) facilitates the translation and commercialization of discoveries into accessible technologies, and licenses more than 2,000 inventions that were borne at JHU.

Our global network includes dozens of partner academic institutions and R&D sites in 100+ countries—as well as our 10,000+ international alumni.

Our IAP allows you to engage directly with our students through tabling events, seminars, and other company-hosted events. A dedicated staff member will assist with planning and strategy to help maximize the impact of your recruiting efforts.

Sponsorship is an ideal way to enhance your company's brand. Becoming a sponsor means you gain exclusive access to a select group of high-achieving students through members-only opportunities. These valuable events provide a way to meet and actively recruit top talent for your organization.
